Portal 2 is one of the most compelling video games of all time. It seems it has everything going for it, timeless visuals, inspired mechanics, a fun story, a talented voice cast, good humour and it's gameplay is superb. It's the type of game I would recommend to anyone and one that holds up.

One of my favorite puzzle games to go back to, had this game on the PS3 and bought it on steam to check out some of the cool custom maps on the workshop. This game also has some great mods like the new "Portal Reloaded" mod which has a new campaign where you have a third portal which allows you to go back in time, along with some other cool mechanics added.

Gamers often confuse games scored 10/10 by professional reviewers as "perfect" or "flawless." Videogames such as Red Dead Redemption, The Last of Us have various qualities that can be improved upon and refined. Nothing can be perfect.

This videogame is the exception.

Portal 2 is a masterwork. The writing is hilarious and necessary - not a single line pads gameplay or wastes the player's time. Gameplay is so inventive, simple and timeless that you could sit someone who has never played a videogame before as I have many times, and they'd not only easily learn the game mechanics but achieve satisfaction as well.

I have nothing to criticise. The game is perfect.

Decent game but no open world or PVP (despite online modes?) Plus the only gun in the entire game can't even shoot anything lethal. Movement is functional but it's missing the good stuff like vaulting, sliding, or sprinting. It's got some futuristic tech (cool cyberpunkish turrets) but it lacks any of the color palette and visual design for synthwave vaporwave aesthetic which ends up making the game just look like a bunch of level testing chambers. Devs just need to work on implementing more exciting features, without good combat mechanics and more items and mechanics, it just feels like a first person puzzle platformer.

If you consider yourself a full on gamer on PC/XBox 360/PS3 and have not played this (and its predecessor) then you are lying to yourself. If you can't seem to finish the game then push on through, watch some walkthroughs, that sort of stuff. The reward will be satisfying. This game is the pinnacle of perfection, a perfect sequel to a perfect game. I would NOT suggest trying to finish this for non-gamers (unlike I would with Portal), yet I would recommend anyone to take a look whenever they can. The graphics are still stunning even to this day and the game is made even better with the inclusion of a workshop for maps as well as a map builder. Of course Hammer would be better if you could use it but lets admit, I tried working with hammer and I must say, the basics left me in a state of keeping away for a wee while. Not to say that it's rocket science, flute sheet music or installing Gentoo but just saying.
What I really have to say is that this is a timeless classic which I recommend to anyone interested, as long as they have played the first game. This is usually on sale for pretty cheap anyway (I got both games in the Portal pack which I got a HUGE deal on for just about $3.50 NZD) so I don't see why you would hesitate to get it.

I played this game for the first time in 2014. By then it was already considered an older game, but I had always been behind when it came to games. At the time it absolutely blew every other game out of the water. I enjoyed the gameplay, the storyline, the mechanics the voices and music, and of course the easter eggs. 7 years later I restarted this game and it just doesn't disappoint. I have played so many games since then, and this one is still by far my favorite. It will always be a classic.
